summary: Russian is a widely spoken East Slavic language with over 258 million speakers globally. It's an official language in many countries, including Russia, Belarus, and Kazakhstan, and is used on the International Space Station and by the United Nations. Russian uses the Cyrillic alphabet, with unique "soft" and "hard" consonant sounds and reduced unstressed vowels. The language's complexity lies in its stress patterns, which are often unpredictable and not marked in writing.
title: Russian language
